DataElement.preferredName: Histology Liquid Tumor Information Descriptive Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text to capture information about a hematological malignancy that may derive from either of the two major blood cell lineages: myeloid and lymphoid cell lines. A subgroup of them are more severe and are known as hematological malignancies or blood cancer, and may also be referred to as liquid tumors.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains._A malignant tumor that originates from myeloid or lymphoid cells i.e., leukemias and lymphomas._Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.:A malignant tumor that originates from myeloid or lymphoid cells i.e., leukemias and lymphomas.

Concepts.definition: The study of the structure of the cells and their arrangement to constitute tissues and, finally, the association among these to form organs.  In pathology, the microscopic process of identifying normal and abnormal morphologic characteristics in tissues, by employing various cytochemical and immunocytochemical stains.
A malignant tumor that originates from myeloid or lymphoid cells i.e., leukemias and lymphomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.

Concepts.definition: Knowledge derived from study, experience, or instruction that has been gathered or received by communication.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The text that provides a description of a topic.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 3/22/22 jk added "Qualified" RS as part of MCL quarterly content review.

DataElement.changeDescription: Cleanup; Curated to support the NCI CTEP Exceptional Responders clinical trial. 7.30.2014 dmr.
